sentences.english: William was angered and embarrassed by his oversight.
sentences.chinese: 威廉因爲自己的疏忽而羞憤交加。

sentences.english: Ashamed and resentfully absence a suicide to Ya Mi.
sentences.chinese: 向雅蜜羞憤的想要自殺。

sentences.english: He went home ashamed and indignant, full of rage.
sentences.chinese: 他羞憤交集地回到家裏，怒火滿腔。

definition: to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
